newsitem.title: USA: Boeing-McDonnell merger might be problem - Pitofsky.
newsitem.headline: Boeing-McDonnell merger might be problem - Pitofsky.

text.p: In a brief comment, Federal Trade Commission Chairman Robert Pitofsky said the merger of Boeing and McDonnell-Douglas "might" be a problem.
Pitofsky was asked Monday evening on CNN's "Moneyline" if having the companies that are "basically two airplane makers in the country" getting together might be a problem.
"It might be," he said. "I hesitate to comment on Boeing and McDonnell Douglas, because we haven't seen any of the documents submitted in support or in opposition to the merger."
In Seattle, a spokeswoman for Boeing said the company is in the process of gathering additional documents requested on March by the FTC. She said that process would take months.
